reviews.title: Avoid -- Unreliable and unprofessional
reviews.text: I reserved a room after negotiating a short-stay rate for 745 SEK (for arrival at 11PM and departure at 5AM: my flight was at 6:30AM). The reservation clerk asked for, and I gave, my credit card number (a standard procedure for a late check-in). But when I arrived at 11PM the night (May 23), the desk clerk told me that my reservation was canceled, allegedly because the clerk who took my reservation mistakenly gave the wrong rate (the excuse was that he thought I was to arrive at 11AM, not 11PM – but why did he ask for my credit card number for a daytime arrival?). The night clerk then told me that I should pay something like 1550 SEK, not the 745 SEK promised initially – although she acknowledged that the reservation clerk made a mistake! Had I known that my reservation was invalid, I could have stayed in a downtown hotel which offered $600 SEK rate for the same service. But I could not go back, because the airport was 30-minute drive from downtown and taxi costs 350 SEK one-way. I refused to be “had” by the hotel, and took the only other option of staying at the airport since there was no other hotel at the airport. I think these guys think they can do whatever they want -- like canceling low-rate reservations when there is shortage of rooms -- because they have the only hotel on the airport. This incidence would not happen in any US hotels rated 3 start and above.

reviews.title: Great convenient hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in September of 2003. It was very convenient to the airport. We were able to walk to the airport. It was a very nice hotel. We had no problems.
I had to travel to Gothenburg on business and was arriving on a late flight from London Heathrow. I normally stay in Gothenburg but the whole city was booked out for a trade fair of some sorts.
reviews.title: Only stay here if there is nothing else available!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only 'decent' place seemed to be the Landvetter Airport Hotel. I arrived and went to check-in and asked could I have a room with a double bed but the receptionist advised that she only had a single as they were full. I was directed down the corridor to a room on the ground floor - room 171. This was a small single room, but in fairness had everything I needed although the bed was a single bed with one side against the wall which I hate. The room was stifling hot when I arrived, so I turned off the radiator to let in a little air to cool the room down. I did some work and then went to close the window as it was 0 Degrees, but the radiator still seemed hot. I closed the window and tried to get to sleep, but the combination of the room heat and the heavy duvet made this very difficult and I tossed and turned for two hours. I called reception and they advised that there was nothing they could do and were very unsympathetic and just told me to leave the window open even when I mentioned about the cold and the aircraft and other noise! To top it all when I finally did manage to get some sleep they started working on the extension to the hotel which seemed to be next to my room.
reviews.title: Convenient but expensive!
Great if you have an early flight
reviews.text: The breakfast the next morning was fine, but when I checked out the receptionist asked if I had a good stay and I told her the saga. She said smiling that it would be better next time but did not apologise or offer any gestures but I told her there wouldn't be a next time.

I was very shocked and surprised by the hotel's lack of customer care and empathy towards their guests and this is something I might have expected 20 years ago - not in 2007. Considering that I paid SEK 1445 for a box room this only added to my lack of satisfaction and poor value for money.
reviews.title: Overall very nice, but ...

reviews.text: I have travelled to Sweden lots of times and it was the worst night's sleep I have ever had in a hotel in that country or anywhere else!
reviews.title: Ok but food service need to imorove

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I made a reservation over the phone a couple of weeks before arrival and got efficient service. The hotel is within a 5 minute walking distance from the airport and lies overlooking the airport. Check-in was quick and we were soon on the way to our room. This was a bit hard to find as there was no signage in the hallways which direction to walk which was a bit strange.
reviews.title: Good location but terribly expensive

reviews.text: Our room was quiet and nice. It featured a big tv and nice bed. It was really well cleaned, almost to the bit that it felt sterile. The only complaint with the room was the toiletries which smelled horrible. The soap had such a strong smell we had to keep the bathroom door closed during the night.
reviews.title: Clean, modern and convenient for an airport stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff both in the reception and in the restaurant were really great and the main reason why I would recommend this hotel. The big letdown with this hotel was instead the restaurant prices. Thinking we could eat a small evening meal at the restaurant we were sad to see that a main course costs about SEK300 with only two options available at SEK150. Instead we had a cheese sandwich from the bar at SEK50. It was nicely prepared but the hotel wanted another SEK50 (i.e. 100% higher price!) if they were to deliver it to our room.
reviews.title: Very good airport hotel

reviews.text: The morning after we awoke at 0840 and strolled down to have breakfast. Surprisingly the breakfast closes already at 0900 and everything is taken away. We had to load up big from the otherwise very nice breakfast. In other hotels I've stayed at they have at least maintained a smaller selection during the late morning.
reviews.title: Convenient location but very average quality

reviews.text: There was an internet computer available in the reception which worked fine.
